items.title: Migrating from Bootstrap Blazor or MudBlazor to Blazorise
items.summary: A deep, objective comparison of design philosophy, performance, extensibility, and migration strategies for teams transitioning from Bootstrap Blazor or MudBlazor to Blazorise.

items.title: Optimizing Rendering and Reconciliation in Large Blazor Apps
items.summary: Deep dive into the Blazor renderer, component lifecycle, and advanced rendering optimizations using ShouldRender, RenderFragments, and lifecycle methods.

items.title: Blazorise 1.8.7 ‚Äì Stability & Long‚ÄëAwaited Fixes
items.summary: Blazorise 1.8.7 delivers several important bug fixes, including a long‚Äëstanding virtualization navigation issue, improved validation behavior, and multiple component refinements.

items.title: Blazorise 1.8.6 ‚Äì .NET 10 Ready
items.summary: Blazorise 1.8.6 adds official support for .NET 10 and delivers multiple DataGrid and FilePicker stability fixes, ensuring a smooth transition for developers upgrading to the latest .NET platform.

items.title: Handling Complex Forms with Validation and Dynamic Rules
items.summary: Learn how to build enterprise-grade Blazor forms using Blazorise Validation, with async validators, conditional rules, and dynamically generated fields.

items.title: Real-Time Blazor Apps: Integrating SignalR and Blazorise Notifications
items.summary: Learn how to build real-time Blazor Server and Blazor WebAssembly apps using SignalR, and surface live updates through Blazorise Toast notifications and ToastService.

items.title: Task Scheduling and Background Services in Blazor Server
items.summary: Learn how to safely run background tasks, update the UI, and schedule recurring jobs in Blazor Server using hosted services, Quartz.NET, and InvokeAsync.

items.title: Blazorise Blog Reimagined ‚Äì A Fresh Start for Our Stories
items.summary: We rebuilt our entire blog and news platform from scratch! Learn how the new system makes it easier for everyone to write, share, and collaborate on Blazorise stories and updates.

items.title: Blazorise 1.8.5 ‚Äì Focused Stability Update
items.summary: Blazorise 1.8.5 delivers important stability fixes, including restored TransferList single-item selection and improved Table event handling to prevent excessive SignalR load on Blazor Server.

items.title: Blazorise 1.8.4 ‚Äì Maintenance Release
items.summary: Blazorise 1.8.4 focuses on stability and polish: major Autocomplete fixes (checkbox blur, overlay, alignment), improved cancellation-token handling for fast typing, a corrected IsEmail validation rule, plus DataGrid localization and Batch Edit fixes.

items.title: Blazorise 1.8.3 ‚Äì Maintenance Release
items.summary: Blazorise 1.8.3 is a focused maintenance update. It fixes the license banner condition, improves DataGrid padding, and resolves an inline edit bug-making Blazorise smoother and more reliable.

items.title: Blazorise Affiliate Program Discontinued
items.summary: Blazorise has discontinued its affiliate program due to misuse and operational burden. This change is effective immediately.

items.title: Blazorise 1.8.2 ‚Äì Maintenance Release (with extras!)
items.summary: Blazorise 1.8.2 brings critical improvements, a few new APIs, and a brand-new FluentUI dark theme-along with focused fixes that improve reliability for developers using Blazorise.

items.title: Blazorise 1.8.1 ‚Äì Maintenance Release
items.summary: We're happy to announce the release of Blazorise 1.8.1, a maintenance update that brings important bug fixes and enhancements to ensure a smoother and more stable experience for developers using Blazorise.

items.title: Announcing Blazorise 1.8 - Lokrum
items.summary: Blazorise 1.8, codenamed Lokrum after the beautiful island in Croatia, is a significant update that brings a host of new features, enhancements, and optimizations to the framework. This release focuses on improving the developer experience, enhancing performance, and expanding the capabilities of Blazorise components.

items.title: üê£ Blazorise 1.7.6 ‚Äì Maintenance Release
items.summary: We're excited to roll out Blazorise 1.7.6 just in time for the Easter holidays! This maintenance release brings a range of stability fixes, quality-of-life improvements, and some meaningful updates to the documentation experience.

items.title: üê£ Blazorise 1.7.7 ‚Äì Maintenance Release
items.summary: We're happy to announce the release of Blazorise 1.7.7, a maintenance update that brings important bug fixes and enhancements to ensure a smoother and more stable experience for developers using Blazorise.

items.title: Blazorise Pricing Update: Transitioning from USD to EUR
items.summary: We're announcing an important update to the pricing structure for Blazorise. Effective immediately, all our product pricing will transition from USD to EUR.

items.title: Maintenance release: Blazorise 1.7.5
items.summary: Blazorise 1.7.5 is a maintenance release focusing on bug fixes and refinements to improve stability and functionality across various components.

items.title: Maintenance release: Blazorise 1.7.4
items.summary: We are excited to announce the release of Blazorise 1.7.4, bringing improvements, fixes, and better documentation for a smoother development experience. This release focuses on refining existing components and enhancing documentation to support developers using Blazorise.

items.title: Maintenance release: Blazorise 1.7.3
items.summary: We're excited to bring you Blazorise 1.7.3, a focused update addressing key issues and delivering important fixes for smoother and more reliable development. This release reflects feedback from the Blazorise community, and we're grateful for your continued support.

items.title: Maintenance release: Blazorise 1.7.2
items.summary: We're excited to announce the maintenance release of Blazorise 1.7.2! This release includes several bug fixes, enhancements, and updates to improve your development experience and streamline our documentation process.

items.title: Maintenance release: Blazorise 1.7.1
items.summary: We're excited to announce the maintenance release of Blazorise 1.7.1! This release includes several bug fixes, enhancements, and updates to improve your development experience and streamline our documentation process.

items.title: Announcing Blazorise 1.7 - Kornati
items.summary: Welcome to the Blazorise 1.7 release, packed with exciting new features, optimizations, and support for the latest .NET framework.

items.title: Publish Blazor App to Azure Container with GitHub Registry
items.summary: Learn how to deploy a Blazor app on Azure Container Apps using GitHub Container Registry with a seamless CI/CD pipeline.

items.title: Maintenance release: Blazorise 1.6.2
items.summary: We are pleased to announce the release of version 1.6.2, which includes important bug fixes and enhancements. This release focuses on improving stability and addressing key issues identified by our user community.

items.title: Blazorise 2.0: Plans and Vision for the Future
items.summary: In this post, we outline the roadmap for Blazorise 1.7 and 2.0, detailing the new features, API changes, and other developments that will shape the future of the project.

items.title: Blazor and Tailwind - Quick Setup Without npm
items.summary: Learn how to seamlessly integrate TailwindCSS with Blazor for a streamlined and efficient web development experience without using npm.

items.summary: This blog post contains the changelog of the most recent bug fixes, improvements and new features included in the Blazorise v1.6 release.

items.title: How to create social media share buttons
items.summary: Discover how to create social media share buttons for your Blazor app! using the framework-agnostic component library Blazorise!

items.summary: Discover how to integrate the Blazorise CAPTCHA component with Blazorise validation for enhanced security.

items.title: How To Create A Blazor Application
items.summary: So far, in our blog posts, we were mainly focused on creating the Blazor app by integrating it with the Blazorise library. This post will run you through the process of creating a new and basic Blazor application.

items.title: Async/Await ‚Äî What Happens Under The Hood
items.summary: Using Async/Await is simple, but there is a lot hidden in these two keywords. To fully understand how it works we will have to run through a bunch of concepts, some of them a little fuzzy but I expect to be able to unveil the mysteries behind Tasks, Threads and Concurrency. Grab your cup of coffee and come with me.

items.title: Practical CSS Tips For Developers
items.summary: In this blog post we will learn some practical tips for applying custom CSS to Blazor and Blazorise components.

items.title: What To Expect In .NET 7
items.summary: We analyze new features currently available in preview 7 of .NET 7, the last preview before the official stable release in November 2022

items.title: ReactiveUI, Blazorise & FluentValidation?
items.summary: In this blog post guides you will learn how to implement ReactiveUI, Blazorise components & FluentValidation.

items.title: Guide: Create A Login and Register Page With Blazorise
items.summary: This blog post guides you on how to create a tabbed login and register page by using blazorise components.

items.title: A Beginner's Guide To .NET MAUI
items.summary: Learn all about the MAUI, a Microsoft's latest multi-platform app UI framework for building Blazor and mobile apps.

items.title: What is Blazor WASM?
items.summary: In this article we will discover what Blazor WASM is, its features and what the kind of applications it can build.

items.title: The Underlying Technology Behind Blazor WebAssembly
items.summary: Learn all about the WebAssembly, The Underlying Technology Behind Blazor WASM, and how it can help you to build a rich UI applications.

items.title: Blazorise Select component with primitive and complex types
items.summary: In this blog post we will look at how to use Blazorise Select Component to bind both primitive and complex types, the select element's limitations, and how to work around them.

items.title: Changes to Blazorise License
